Responsibilities:
• Supervise a team of technicians and maintain sufficient consumable parts in the proper repair and maintenance of various office equipments and Electrical & Mechanical System
• Resolve technical problem, trouble shooting of machinery failure and exercise prompt resumption
• Arrange and implement planned preventative maintenance work as assigned
• Monitor project progress and supervise contractors’ performance
• Oversee issues relating to office environment, procurement of office furniture, office relocation and renovation
• Prepare tender documents, service orders, incident reports, as-built documents, inventory record, licence and agreement records
• Review, evaluate and ensure full performance of building service contracts
• Handle emergency calls during non-office hours

Qualifications & Experience required:
• Higher Diploma or above in Building Services, Facility Management, Electrical and Mechanical Engineering or related discipline
• 6 years of relevant experience from sizeable companies with at least 2 years in supervisory role
• Registered Grade A0 Electrical Worker will be an advantage
• Knowledge and experience in statutory regulations, code of practice and safety rules
• Willing to hand on all facility and administration related tasks
• Strong problem solving and interpersonal skills, detail-oriented and able to work independently
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and AutoCAD
• Proficiency in both written and spoken English and Chinese

Candidates with less experience will be considered for the position of Assistant Technical Officer.

We offer a competitive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience to the right candidate including Global Profit Share scheme, additional fringe benefits of maternity/paternity leave and long-term career development opportunities.
